revised_title: Electron Microscopy of Nematocyst Thread Structure and Discharge in Corynactis Viridis
tldr: The authors conducted electron microscopy studies on the nematocyst thread structure and discharge in the marine organism Corynactis viridis. They discovered that the undischarged nematocyst thread has a screw-like shape due to helical pleats in the membrane, which transforms into a smooth cylinder during discharge. The thread's structure and dimensional changes during discharge were analyzed, providing insights into the function and mechanics of nematocyst discharge in this species.
